alert.note: Alert for Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 3:27PM MDT until June 07 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding across the northeast corner of the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon burn scar. Between 0.10 and 0.25 inches of rain has fallen, in addition to pea size hail. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, Mora. The heaviest rainfall occurred between Holman and El Turquillo. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 324 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.1 and 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Most of the minor flooding is expected within Trumbell Canyon toward St. Teresa church along Highway 434. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mora, La Cueva, Cleveland, Luceros, El Turquillo, Rainsville and Guadalupita. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak/Calf Canyon fire burn area.
